metadata.title: CVE-2017-6350 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
An integer overflow at an unserialize_uep memory allocation site wouldoccur for vim before patch 8.0.0378, if it does not properly validatevalues for tree length when reading a corrupted undo file, which may leadto resultant buffer overflows.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6350` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-athena - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-athena-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-gnome - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-gnome-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-gtk - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-gtk-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-gtk3 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-gtk3-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-nox - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-nox-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-runtime - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-tiny - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4').
